message.body: this chat room is much neater than the original :)
hola everyone
@yilmazerkan@zv, @basxto@zid nice job with this chat application. It seems much better than the rest around zeronet
@basxto@zid: this user "pizzagod" is a known diaspora troll. Nevermind him or his posts
@yilmazerkan@zv: is this 0net:// protocol implementation for real?
meaning... does it translate to the 127.0.0.1... protocol always?
well, it's a pretty smart-looking application of a protocol. Perhaps somebody could pitch @nofish and the rest of the devs to create that implementation network-wide?
@yilmazerkan@zv: I keep getting "Forbidden: opener present" errors from those links... although your blog otherwise opens fine. A bug perhaps?
Although I agree, that'
that's a great idea "D
@yilmazerkan@zv: +1 for more peers and less lurking via proxies
I remember last year many people were lazy and instead of hosting an instance, kept using classcoder's inproxy. Good thing that times have changed!
@basxto@zid: yeah, I remember that only classcoder's eventually implemented https://, also many use port 43110, which some firewalls block
@basxto@zid: @yilmazerkan@zv: so do I sometimes. especially bit.no.com's!
@yilmazerkan@zv interesting post! Didn't realize there was such site as a ZeroPress!
great interview that one, btw. Very inspirational!
@basxto@zid: ah so that's where the grey looks come from! I suspected. Hey @yilmazerkan@zv you should redesign your blog to match your sites' CSS
:D
I played a little bit with the standard ZeroBlog css. It's pretty flexible once you do understand how does the index.html get structured. A harder piece to tackle is the js files
@basxto@zid: I like this PastePr! Could it become the basis for some sort of code repository engine in ZeroNet?
not a bad idea!
I see. Well, having a paste system here already makes many things possible. Perhaps this distributed code repository thing is the next big thing, code-wise
perhaps ZeroNet then would be self-hostable: hosting ZeroNet code within ZeroNet itself
hmm I see. A big difference that I see is that NullPaste also lists recent pastes, a la pastebin.com
that is a good one too! But it never seems to work here in my machine :(
seems very powerful indeed :)
alright, g2g guys. Thanks for a lovely afternoon chat! @basxto@zid @yilmazerkan@zv
